domain.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board Object is where the squares and cup that holds the dice are stand on. it is also the class where the movement is calculated.
    Author:
    Goko

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Board getInstance()
        Singleton board, getInstance method.
        Returns:
        if its not created before, creates a new one if not, returns the same board object.

      • rollCup

        public void rollCup()
        Rolls the dice in the cup one by one. Checks the conditions of double, Mr Monopoly etc

      • movePiece

        public java.util.ArrayList<domain.model.squares.Square> movePiece(domain.model.players.Player currentPlayer)
        Moves the piece of the current player according to the current faceValues of the dice.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - the Player who has the turn.
        Returns:
        A List of Square's that the player's piece has passed.

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece(domain.model.players.Player currentPlayer,
                      domain.model.squares.Square squareToMove)
        Moves the current player's piece to the target square immediately. For action methods
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The player who has the turn
        squareToMove - The target square that the piece will go.

      • getSquareLayerIndex

        public int getSquareLayerIndex(domain.model.squares.Square sq)
        When searching for a certain square on the board, this gets us the layer.
        Parameters:
        sq - The square that we are trying to find
        Returns:
        the int value of the layer that contains target square.

      • getSquareIndex

        public int getSquareIndex(domain.model.squares.Square sq)
        With the method above after we find the layer that contains the target square this method iterates over the squares till it finds the square.
        Parameters:
        sq - the target square
        Returns:
        The squares index number in the list.
